Package org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.setting.credentials

Class PasswordHolder

java.lang.Object
org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.setting.credentials.PasswordHolder
public final class PasswordHolder extends Object
Since we do not want to send passwords to the frontend when serializing Credentials, we need to store them temporarily in order to receive passwords again when deserializing. When passwords are no longer needed, because the associated node dialog has been deactivated, they should be removed from the map here again. This is why we also remember the node id for every stored password.
Author:
Paul BÃ¤rnreuther

  • Method Details

    • activate

      public static final void activate(org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeID nodeID)
      Call this method in order to allow writing passwords to the password holder. The passwords are associated with the given nodeID to be removed later using removeAllPasswordsOfDialog(org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeID).
      Parameters:
      nodeID -

    • deactivate

      public static final void deactivate()
      Deactivate writing new passwords to the password holder

    • removeAllPasswordsOfDialog

      public static void removeAllPasswordsOfDialog(org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeID nodeId)
      Tear down method to remove all passwords from the global map when they are not necessary anymore.
      Parameters:
      nodeId - the id of node container associated to the dialog.

    • setCredentialsProvider

      public static void setCredentialsProvider(org.knime.core.node.workflow.CredentialsProvider cp)
      Set a credentials provider temporarily in order to enable deserializing credential input fields overwritten by flow variables.
      Parameters:
      cp - a credentialsProvider accessible vie getSuppliedCredentialsProvider()

    • removeCredentialsProvider

      public static void removeCredentialsProvider()
